descript.abstract: Layer identifies the location of religious centers throughout St Vincent and the Grenadines. The centers represent all the major/recognized institutions icluding Anglican, Catholic, Pentecostal, Methodist, and Seventh Day Adventist. Other minor detonations are also represented include Latter Day Saints, Baptist, and Wesleyan. The attribute table is incomplete specifically for the congregation number. Attempts were made to collect data but were not successful. "No Data" values are represented as "-9999" in the atribute table.
descript.purpose: Developed to locate and visualize religious centers in St Vincent and the Grenadines. This information will help inform the Nature Conservancy's AWE project and the resilience of social networks during inundation events for St Vincent and the Grenadines. Scientists around the world agree that climate change is indisputable. Impacts, including rising sea levels, increased storm intensity, warming temperatures and acidifying waters, dying coral reefs, shifting fish stocks, and incidence of flooding and drought, are already being felt, and are expected to continue and increase for decades to come. Nature holds some of the world’s best and most practical solutions to climate change, solutions that keep nature and people healthy, safe, and secure. The goal of At the Water’s Edge (AWE) is to demonstrate that governments and people in vulnerable coastal communities in Grenada and St. Vincent and the Grenadines (SVG) can enhance their resilience to climate change by protecting, restoring and effectively managing their marine and coastal ecosystems (also known as ecosystem-based adaptation or EBA) and strengthening local capacity for adaptation.
